headline: Packaging Stocks Are Today’s Leading Decliners. The Tariff Turmoil Doesn’t Help.
summary: Shares of U.S. packaging companies were among the market’s leading fallers on Monday as cardboard prices unexpectedly fell in response to sluggish demand.  Containerboard prices for February fell by $20 a ton from January, triggered by a rise in discounts, according to data released Friday by index provider RISI.  Smurfit Westrock  stock dropped 5.9% in premarket trading Monday,  Packaging Corp. of America  fell 7%, and  International Paper  was down 7%.
